messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.net

LGTM
On 6 Nov 2012 22:09, <mikioh.mikioh@gmail.com> wrote:

> Reviewers: golang-dev_googlegroups.com,
>
> Message:
> Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),
>
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go.**net <https://code.google.com/p/go.net>
>
>
> Description:
> go.net: gofmt -w -s
>
> Please review this at http://codereview.appspot.com/**6811084/<http://codereview.appspot.com/6811084/>
>
> Affected files:
>   M ipv4/doc.go
>   M spdy/types.go
>   M websocket/hybi_test.go
>
>
> Index: ipv4/doc.go
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/ipv4/doc.go
> +++ b/ipv4/doc.go
> @@ -22,7 +22,7 @@
>  // important, ipv4.Conn is used to set the type-of-service field on
>  // the IPv4 header for each packet.
>  //
> -//     ln, err := net.Listen("tcp4", "0.0.0.0:1024")
> +//     ln, err := net.Listen("tcp4", "0.0.0.0:1024")
>  //     if err != nil {
>  //             // error handling
>  //     }
> Index: spdy/types.go
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/spdy/types.go
> +++ b/spdy/types.go
> @@ -355,8 +355,8 @@
>  }
>
>  // NewFramer allocates a new Framer for a given SPDY connection,
> repesented by
> -// a io.Writer and io.Reader. Note that Framer will read and write
> individual fields
> -// from/to the Reader and Writer, so the caller should pass in an
> appropriately
> +// a io.Writer and io.Reader. Note that Framer will read and write
> individual fields
> +// from/to the Reader and Writer, so the caller should pass in an
> appropriately
>  // buffered implementation to optimize performance.
>  func NewFramer(w io.Writer, r io.Reader) (*Framer, error) {
>         compressBuf := new(bytes.Buffer)
> Index: websocket/hybi_test.go
> ==============================**==============================**=======
> --- a/websocket/hybi_test.go
> +++ b/websocket/hybi_test.go
> @@ -535,8 +535,8 @@
>  }
>
>  // Test the hybiServerHandshaker supports firefox implementation and
> -// checks Connection request header include (but it's not necessary
> -// equal to) "upgrade"
> +// checks Connection request header include (but it's not necessary
> +// equal to) "upgrade"
>  func TestHybiServerFirefoxHandshake**(t *testing.T) {
>         config := new(Config)
>         handshaker := &hybiServerHandshaker{Config: config}
>
>
>

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=c86d1f439e36&repo=net ***

go.net: gofmt -w -s

R=golang-dev, dave
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6811084
